title: Florida’s New Voting Law Challenged for Making Registration Harder
description: A group of civil rights organizations challenged a Florida voting law signed by Governor Ron DeSantis that they claim will make it harder for Blacks and Latinos to register to vote.

title: DeSantis Campaign Debut on Twitter Faces Technical Glitches
description: Ron DeSantis’ live event on Twitter was beset by technical glitches and audio problems as the social network’s servers struggled to handle the surge of demand.

title: Could $25 Billion in Social Security Payments Force a Debt-Limit Deal?
description: On Friday, June 2, millions of Americans are due a total of $25 billion worth of Social Security payments. And more than anything else, that may prove a decisive element in forcing an end to the partisan standoff over raising the federal debt limit.

title: Citi’s $7 Billion Banamex Sale Scuttled After AMLO Intervenes
description: Citigroup Inc. spent 16 months preparing its Banamex unit for a sale that ultimately fizzled after meddling by Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.

title: US, South Korea Start Live-Fire Drills Set to Anger Pyongyang
description: The US and South Korea are set to begin their largest-ever live-fire drills that will take place near the border with North Korea, which has threatened retaliation against the two nations it labels “war maniacs.”

title: Any Debt-Limit Deal Still Faces Time-Consuming Hurdles to Avoid Default
description: Once President Joe Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy shake hands on a debt-limit deal, there is still a procedural and political gauntlet to run before the US can avert a default.

title: Connecticut’s New Haven Commuter Rail Line to Manhattan Faces Possible Cuts
description: Connecticut residents may see reduced commuter-rail service to Manhattan if state lawmakers cut funds that help the Metropolitan Transportation Authority operate its New Haven Line.

title: A Biden-McCarthy Handshake is Just the Beginning for a Debt Deal
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. We're focusing this week on the debt-ceiling drama. Today, Anna Edgerton and Steven T. Dennis look at how it could end. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: A Year After Uvalde, Biden Renews Call for Assault Weapons Ban
description: President Joe Biden renewed his call for Congress to ban assault weapons and high-capacity magazines, as well as enact other gun safety measures as he observed the one-year anniversary of a deadly mass shooting at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas.

title: Move Over, Murdoch. Musk's Huge Fortune Makes Him Political Kingmaker
description: Ron DeSantis’s plan to announce his 2024 presidential campaign in a Twitter conversation with Elon Musk shows how the world’s second-richest person is increasingly inserting himself into US politics, setting him up as a leading powerbroker for the 2024 race.

title: Chinese Hackers Targeting US, Guam Aim to Disrupt Communications, Microsoft Says
description: Microsoft Corp. said it’s found malicious activity by a Chinese-state sponsored hacking group that has stealthily gained access into critical infrastructure organizations in Guam and elsewhere in the US, with the likely aim of disrupting critical communications in the event of a crisis.

title: Canada, Saudi Arabia Restore Ties Broken Before Khashoggi Crisis
description: Canada and Saudi Arabia agreed to resume normal diplomatic relations, repairing ties that frayed nearly five years ago in a dispute over human rights.

title: Ron DeSantis Enters 2024 Presidential Race
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis officially jumped into the race for president, giving former President Donald Trump his strongest challenger yet for the Republican nomination.

title: McCarthy Faces Pressure From Conservatives Vital to His Job as Debt Talks Resume
description: House conservatives ratcheted up pressure on Speaker Kevin McCarthy to hold firm in talks over raising the debt ceiling just days before a potentially catastrophic US default.

title: US State Department’s Top China Official Is Stepping Down
description: The State Department’s most senior official focused solely on China announced Wednesday that he’s stepping down at a tumultuous time in the US relationship with Beijing.

title: T-Bills No Longer the Only Market Getting Jittery About the Debt Ceiling Fight
description: In addition to Treasury bills, default-risk concerns appear to be affecting US equities too

title: George Santos Secures Three Mystery Guarantors for $500,000 Bail in Fraud Case
description: George Santos, the embattled Republican congressman charged with fraud and money laundering, has secured three unidentified guarantors for his $500,000 bond.

title: UK to Probe Flagship Teesworks Site After Corruption Allegations
description: Rishi Sunak’s government will commission an independent review into the development of the northern England Teesworks site, following allegations of corruption around a project at the heart of the Conservative Party’s pledge to boost disadvantaged areas of the country.

title: Germany Buys Tanks, Howitzers in Jumbo Defense Order
description: German lawmakers gave the green light to buy 18 battle tanks and 12 self-propelled howitzers from domestic manufacturers Rheinmetall AG and Krauss-Maffei Wegmann GmbH as part of an order worth €843 million ($910 million) to replace equipment sent to Ukraine.

title: Greece’s Mitsotakis Confirms New Election to Be Held on June 25
description: Greece will hold new elections in a month after this weekend’s ballot failed to produce a government.

title: Biden Pressed to Limit Hydrogen Credits Key to Nascent Industry
description: Senate Democrats are pushing the Biden administration to impose tough limits on hydrogen tax credits they say will ensure the fuel lives up to its climate-fighting potential. Hydrogen advocates warn that could end up stifling the nascent industry instead.

title: Brexit Caused a Third of UK Food Price Inflation, LSE Paper Says
description: Brexit is responsible for a third of UK food price inflation since 2019, according to research by the London School of Economics that undermines efforts by the government to show the EU divorce has benefited Britain.

title: Rishi Sunak Finds UK Inflation May Follow Him Into Election Year
description: If Prime Minister Rishi Sunak thought inflation would drop away quickly this year, delivering an easy victory in the build-up to the election expected in 2024, Wednesday’s data was a rude awakening.

title: AMLO Says Mexico Could Offer $3 Billion For a Stake in Banamex
description: Citigroup Inc.’s Banamex “could represent a good opportunity” for Mexico to own a bank, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said Wednesday after the US bank announced that it would halt a direct sale of the unit.

title: Mozambique Loses Appeal to Stop Ex-Minister’s Extradition to US
description: South Africa’s top court blocked a bid to stop the extradition of former Mozambican Finance Minister Manuel Chang to the US, where he’s wanted on charges related to his role in a $2 billion sovereign-debt scandal.

title: Half of Americans Say Congress Should Raise Debt Limit Without Strings Attached
description: Half of Americans say the US debt ceiling should be raised without strings attached, while just 25% say it should be tied to negotiations over a package of spending cuts demanded by House Republicans, according to a new Monmouth University Poll.

title: GOP, Biden Negotiators Set to Meet Amid Debt Default Impasse
description: Negotiators for the White House and House Republicans were set to meet at noon to resume talks on lifting the US debt ceiling amid an impasse just days before a potentially catastrophic default, according to people familiar with plans.

title: Yellen Says Treasury Pushing for Debt-Limit Deal, Not Prepping for Default
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said that signs of market stress are now beginning to emerge as the federal government moves closer to running out of cash, and that the Biden administration’s focus is on completing a debt-limit deal rather than contingency planning for a default.

title: Bank of Russia Chief Visits Iran in Rare Trip Abroad Since War
description: Bank of Russia Governor Elvira Nabiullina held talks with her Iranian counterpart during a visit to Tehran, a rare foreign outing since she was sanctioned over Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Yellen Says Treasury Uninvolved With Banks in Default Planning
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the Biden administration is committed to not having missed payments and to raising the debt ceiling, and that her department is not involved in planning for a default.

title: On the Debt Ceiling, the White House Is Doing What It Said It Wouldn't Do
description: They're negotiating.

title: Yellen Reiterates Treasury May Run Out of Cash as Soon as June 1
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen reiterated that her department may run out of cash to pay the nation’s bills as soon as June 1.

title: France’s Le Pen Rejects Accusations She Was Influenced by Putin
description: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen said no foreign power has ever tried to influence her as she sought to shake off accusations that her party’s ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban have influenced her policies.

title: What’s Trending Today: DeSantis Campaign Announcement, Lottery Scam, Celtics Stay in Playoffs
description: Welcome to Social Buzz, a daily column looking at what’s trending on social media platforms. I’m Caitlin Fichtel, an editor on Bloomberg’s Breaking News team, which monitors everything from company statements to tweets from some of the most prominent people in the financial world. Here’s your daily look at what the internet is talking about.

title: Potential Debt Deal Seen Worsening US Recession, Job Destruction
description: Spending cuts expected in an eventual deal to raise the US debt limit could cost the country as many as 570,000 jobs, exacerbating the recession seen coming later this year, according to Bloomberg Economics.

title: Swiss Back Sale of 25 Tanks to Germany to Support Ukraine Effort
description: Germany’s request to buy 25 mothballed Swiss Leopard 2 tanks, intended to make up for stocks it’s sending to Ukraine, won the support of Switzerland’s government.

title: UK’s Labour Party Could Gain From SNP’s Troubles in Scotland, Poll Shows
description: The Scottish National Party, which is mired in a financial scandal following the departure of leader Nicola Sturgeon, could lose more than 20 seats to a resurgent Labour Party at the next UK general election, according to YouGov polling.

title: China Prioritizes Hunt for Spies Over Economy
description: For decades, China promised foreign investors it was opening up. Now, Beijing looks intent on closing down some channels.

title: Russian Wagner Chief Blasts Outcome of Putin’s Ukraine War Goals
description: The founder of the Wagner mercenary group delivered a scathing critique of the outcome of President Vladimir Putin’s war goals in Ukraine, highlighting growing nationalist anger at Russia’s faltering 15-month invasion.

title: Braverman Avoids Ethics Probe as Sunak Says She Didn’t Break Ministerial Code
description: Rishi Sunak will not refer Home Secretary Suella Braverman to an ethics probe over her handling of a speeding ticket last summer, after concluding she did not break the ministerial code.

title: Somalia’s Oil-Rich Puntland Region to Hold Landmark Elections
description: Somalia’s oil-rich Puntland region will on Thursday hold its first democratic local elections since 1967, a significant turnaround for the semi-autonomous state that’s long been known as a haven for international piracy and hideout for the Islamic State in the Horn of Africa.

title: Debt-Limit Talks Stall as Time Runs Short to Avert US Default
description: Debt limit talks in Washington have hit a fresh impasse with negotiators far apart on key issues, especially the spending cuts demanded by Republicans, as time runs short to avert a historic US default.

title: German Climate Activists Targeted in Nationwide Raids
description: Authorities searched 15 properties across Germany in connection with a criminal investigation against a climate activist group that has gained notoriety for blocking major roads and disrupting airport traffic.

title: Erdogan Challenger Wins Support of Nationalist Party in Runoff
description: Turkey’s main opposition leader won the endorsement of a small nationalist party that could help him close the gap with President Recep Erdogan in Sunday’s runoff election.

title: Roubini Sees Debt Talks Dragging; Petraeus on China: Qatar Forum
description: Nouriel Roubini warned Wednesday that talks to avoid a US default could drag on, with failure to agree on a debt ceiling likely to hit markets and damage confidence in the dollar over the longer term.

title: Modi’s Popularity Endures Despite Recent India State Poll Defeat
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s popularity remains strong despite his party’s loss in a crucial state election, but his main rival Rahul Gandhi is also gaining ground, indicating the opposition could gather momentum ahead of the 2024 national election.

title: Pakistan Considers Banning Imran Khan’s Party, Minister Says
description: Pakistan is considering banning Imran Khan’s political party, Defense Minister Khawaja Asif said in a televised address, deepening the already tense standoff between the former premier and the country’s government and powerful military.

title: Far-Right Surges in Estonia Amid Outrage Over Tax Increases
description: Estonia’s far right surged ahead of Prime Minister Kaja Kallas’s party in an opinion poll after the newly elected premier came under pressure for tax hikes and spending cuts.

title: Export Controls Emerge as a Favored US Tool Targeting Russia and China
description: Enforcement actions are increasing, along with the roster of companies that US firms need licenses to deal with.

title: EU Nations Told to Prioritize Inflation Fight Amid Turbulence
Roubini Says US Debt Deal Could Reach ‘Last Hour’: Qatar Forum
description: Nouriel Roubini warned Wednesday that talks to avoid a US default could drag on, with failure to agree on a debt ceiling likely to hit markets and damage confidence in the dollar over the longer term.

title: Ukraine Recap: Russia Reports a Large Number of Drone Attacks
description: The governor of Russia’s Belgorod region reported a “large number” of drone attacks overnight, causing damage to buildings, though he said most were intercepted by air defenses.

title: Roubini Warns US-China Cold War Risks Worsening After G-7 Summit
description: Nouriel Roubini warned the US and China are headed down a path of confrontation after a Group of Seven summit in Japan.

title: Israel Passes Two-Year Budget With Big Grants to Ultra-Orthodox
description: Israel’s parliament passed a national two-year budget that includes billions of dollars in funding for West Bank settlements and religious programs, stabilizing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing coalition. The shekel weakened as critics warned the plan would suppress rather than spur economic growth.

title: Eskom Latest: Food Maker Installs Solar; Bigger Cuts for Longer
description: South African food producer RFG Holdings Ltd. will complete solar installations at seven of its production facilities over the next 18 month, accelerating its renewable energy program as the state-owned power utility struggles to meet demand for electricity.

title: Russian Premier Says China Ties at ‘Unprecedented’ Level
description: Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin told China’s premier that bilateral relations are stronger than ever, as Moscow looks to Beijing to help it withstand the economic pressure of US-led sanctions.

title: Opposition Coalition Takes Shape Ahead of South African Election
description: An opposition coalition that aims to end the South African ruling party’s three-decade hold on power is taking shape ahead of national elections next year.

title: Putin’s Central Bank Is Also on the Battlefield in Ukraine
description: President Vladimir Putin has increasingly put Russia’s economy on a war footing since his invasion of Ukraine. The central bank is also being enlisted for the fight under a decorated military officer installed as a deputy governor.

title: Supreme Court’s Approval Rating Slides as Clarence Thomas Faces Ethics Controversies
description: Public confidence in the US Supreme Court slid amid a flurry of ethics controversies, including revelations that Justice Clarence Thomas got luxury vacations and other benefits from a Republican megadonor, according to a new Marquette Law School Poll.

title: UK’s Chancellor-in-Waiting Lays Out Plan for More Activist State
description: The UK opposition’s pick to manage the economy outlined plans for a more activist state if her party comes to power, saying a Labour government will invest in strategic industries to boost Britain’s economic self-reliance.

title: Modi Uses Cricket Analogy For Rapidly Improving Australia Ties
description: Australia’s relationship with India has entered “T-20” mode, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said after meeting his counterpart Anthony Albanese, referring to a shortened, fast-paced cricket format popular in both countries.

title: Here’s How Thailand’s PM Race Could Play Out as Talks Drag On
description: Talks over forming Thailand’s next government are well into their second week and there’s still no sign that a pro-democracy coalition led by Move Forward will garner the support it needs to ensure that Pita Limjaroenrat becomes the nation’s 30th prime minister.

title: New York City Asks Judge to Suspend Right-to-Shelter Amid Influx
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has asked a judge to temporarily suspend a 42-year-old court ruling requiring the city to shelter homeless adults amid a surge in asylum seekers that’s weighed on the municipal budget.

title: Trump Lawyers Seek Meeting With Garland on Special Counsel Probe
description: Donald Trump’s attorneys are seeking a meeting with Attorney General Merrick Garland related to a special counsel’s probe of the former US president.

title: Investors in Thailand Face Bumpy Ride Until New Government Sits
description: Thailand’s financial markets are set for a bumpy ride as investors may have to wait until August to find out whether a coalition of pro-democracy parties can take government after concerns about political jostling triggered the steepest post-poll selloff in two decades.

title: Brazil Lower House Approves Lula’s New Fiscal Framework Proposal
description: Brazil’s lower house of congress on Tuesday approved its version of the government’s new fiscal framework proposal, President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s main legislative priority.

title: Chief Justice Roberts Says He’s Committed to Highest Standards
description: Chief Justice John Roberts said he is “committed” to ensuring the Supreme Court adheres to the highest standards of conduct, even as some justices come under increased scrutiny by the public and Congress.

title: Dutch Foreign Minister Sees ‘Pivotal Role’ for China in Ukraine
description: Dutch Foreign Minister Wopke Hoekstra stressed China’s pivotal role in finding a solution to global conflicts, while pressing his counterpart for more balanced trade relations during a meeting in Beijing.

title: US Must Widen China Chip Curbs in Micron Response, Lawmaker Says
description: A prominent US lawmaker is urging Washington to strike back against China for its decision to bar Micron Technology Inc.’s memory chips, threatening to further inflame tensions between the two countries.

title: Xi Upends the Secretive World of $10,000-an-Hour China Experts
description: Private conversations with corporate insiders and ex-government officials that cost upwards of $10,000 an hour. Coded language and blurred regulatory lines.
